Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)
Code looks mostly good;  One minor nit that's optional.
I don't think we need this fallback.
Thanks Ed for quick review, resolved in ps5.
Any testing here?
Yes, tested.

For next time, please add a "Tested" statement. 
https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/f167b6d2994c2bd6b3f58143e65b9ba66e9cdb19/CONTRIBUTING.md?plain=1#L262
Acknowledged

So if there is more than 1, we just return the first for now?
In the future, we should support multiple BMCs/Systems.
This does break for https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/systems.hpp#L2825 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/hypervisor_system.hpp
I wonder if we could just skip /redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor, I don't see support for it in the webui-vue, only in bmcweb.

If consideration current implementation in bmcweb, we can just return the first member. If to make it safer, we can skip the /redfish/v1/Systems/hypervisor. But not sure if other systems will come in the future.

with the goal of making progress on this (and it being an improvement to not hardcode) I would suggest we just take the "last element" instead of "first element" which fixes the hypervisor case functionally, even if it relies on bmcweb to keep a known order based on human name, which is reasonable, and we do in other collections even if redfish doesn't require it.

I think that's better than explicitly excluding hypervisor;  In the future I suspect folks will need to change up this code to add multiple system support anyway, so hopefully this doesn't have to live long.

> this works for now. 

I agree.
Acknowledged
